title: Data Science in Indian Business
content:
Module 3, Lesson 10: Data Science in Indian Business

The Hook

Data science is transforming India's economy. Understanding how it is applied at Flipkart, HDFC Bank, HUL, and Indian Railways bridges academic knowledge with professional practice.

The Concept

1. Flipkart: demand forecasting and personalisation

Understanding Flipkart: demand forecasting and personalisation is foundational to this topic. Indian companies and research institutions apply these principles in production AI systems every day.

2. HDFC Bank: credit scoring and fraud detection

HDFC Bank: credit scoring and fraud detection forms the core methodology for practitioners. India's tech ecosystem from Bengaluru to Hyderabad deploys these approaches at scale.

3. Hindustan Unilever: consumer insights at village level

Hindustan Unilever: consumer insights at village level is critical for building reliable AI solutions. Top Indian firms like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and startups like Razorpay all leverage these techniques.

4. Indian Railways: predictive maintenance

Mastering Indian Railways: predictive maintenance separates good practitioners from great ones. Apply these concepts on Indian open datasets from data.gov.in to build hands-on expertise.

The Illustration

This lesson covered Flipkart: demand forecasting and personalisation, HDFC Bank: credit scoring and fraud detection, Hindustan Unilever: consumer insights at village level, and Indian Railways: predictive maintenance. These are the building blocks of data science in indian business â€” master them through practice on real Indian datasets.

quiz.question: What does Flipkart use ML demand forecasting for?
options: Predicting which SKUs to stock at which warehouses

quiz.question: What does thin-file borrower mean in credit scoring?
options: A borrower with no formal credit history

quiz.question: What does HiPPO stand for in data-driven decision making?
What app does HUL use to gather rural retail outlet data?
What improvement has predictive maintenance brought to Indian Railways?
options: 15-20% reduction in maintenance costs and improved on-time performance
